body: Doesn't it use INFO as default level?
LGTM

No, I didn't put rootLogger into INFO level arbitrarily. The reason is:
1. not all DEBUG messages are useless, sometimes meaningful DEBUG msg could benefit debugging ERRORs, we can just get rid of DEBUG log dumping, only keep DEBUG message that we're interested of, such as eagle's.
2. this way of ignoring messy DEBUG msg is just to let spring and apache-commons components log above INFO level by default, separated from rootLogger's DEBUG so that we will have more flexible controls on logs of different components.

Do these make sense?
@haoch , or did you mean to set rootLogger at INFO level by default, and add components' DEBUG msg as needed?

Fixed at https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/commit/9d16f213c991a816b4cf89732a51243b871b0c5a on `develop` branch
Good fix. To become a high-quality project, we should at least try to make sure cleaning all compiling warning if possible.

The bug is due to an old-version hive's bug. If we use a query like this: "SELECT user, id FROM db.table", we would get exceptions. This bug was fixed in hive-1.3 and after https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-10731.
We are using hive-1.2 in Eagle which has this kind of bug.
The fix looks good to me. Tested on my local side. Thanks for fixing, @wangyum
merged into branch-0.4

Reviewed.
This fix is for "distinct" which we did not support before. So add "TOK_FUNCTIONDI" in the parser to parse "distinct".
Looks good to me. It can be merged.
fixed and merged

building eagle-topology-assembly failed because eagle-security-hdfs-securitylog and eagle-security-hbase-securitylog are renamed, and eagle-security-userprofile are removed.

As a **high-quality** project,  it is better passing build before submitting.

@yonzhang , yes, for RDBMS, after the service is up, it will create tables automatically. This functionality has been fully tested.
This pull request is to make sure no matter what the database is, starting Eagle service has a same procedure.

Are you using maven-release-plugin? (Actually it's inherited from the Apache parent POM.)

It is able to update versions in all your pom.xml files automatically, removing -SNAPSHOT before the release and adding it back after the release.
Merged.
merged, please close

@julianhyde , no, the changes of this PR is not made by maven-release-plugin. I was using maven-version-plugin to erase the -SNAPSHOT suffix. 

Actually I'm researching maven-release-plugin, trying to do some experiment with it.
